title: North Andover officer shot by colleague released from jail
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The injuries Kelsey Fitzsimmons suffered during the incident have now healed enough that she can use an alcohol breath test safely.
North Andover Police Officer Kelsey Fitzsimmons during her arraignment in August.

Ben Pennington/for the Boston Globe Kelsey Fitzsimmons, the North Andover police officer who was shot by a colleague after allegedly pointing a gun at him during a confrontation in June, was released from custody Tuesday.

title: 2 dead in multi-vehicle crash in Watertown
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Local News An investigation into the crash remains ongoing by the Watertown Police Department and Massachusetts State Police.
Two people died in a multi-vehicle crash Tuesday afternoon in Watertown, according to police.
Watertown police and firefighters responded to the scene on Bigelow Avenue around noon.

title: Readers: Have you ever been a third wheel?

title: 10 towns remain defiant of MBTA Communities Act as year-end deadline looms
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Local News The clock is ticking for these communities as they weigh the consequences of standing firm against the law.
A water tower is seen in the Point Shirley neighborhood of Winthrop, Massachusetts October 29, 2025.
The town is fighting against a state housing law that would bring more development to town which has dredged up broader fears about economic and social change.
